thread.title: Ray Parlour picks his England team to go to next year’s World Cup… but there’s one big error
thread.title_full: Ray Parlour picks his England team to go to next year’s World Cup… but there’s one big error

author: smorgan
title: Ray Parlour picks his England team to go to next year’s World Cup… but there’s one big error
text:
5 
“Then Jordan Henderson and maybe Eric Dier. I’m looking at how Chelsea play with N’Golo Kante, Nemanja Matic and Cesc Fabregas. I would change it. 
“If you’re not playing against Germany or Spain, and instead someone like Scotland, you can afford to put more midfielders in. Ross Barkley and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain are options. 
“Then I would have Raheem Sterling on the right. Dele Alli has got to play just behind the front. Getty Images Ray Parlour believes a fully-fit Harry Kane should be starting up top for the Three Lions Rex Features Jermain Defoe scored against Lithuania but he doesn’t make it into Ray Parlour’s side Jemain Defoe holds Bradley Lowery's hand as they lead the England team out at Wembley Most read in football diamonds are forever Chelsea's new Nike kit leaked online... and it looks just like shirt from 30 years ago when they were relegated in shame Big neym signing Man Utd in 'talks with Neymar's agent over £173m move and £416k-a-week deal' LIONHEART Brave Bradley Lowery gets the biggest cheer at Wembley as he leads out the England team with goal hero and best mate Jermain Defoe leg-break horror Seamus Coleman set for surgery on potential career-threatening injury after his leg is snapped in half by Neil Taylor's wild tackle Tied down Chelsea 'agree' £35m fee with Monaco for midfield star Tiemoue Bakayoko on lucrative five-year deal NOT FOR SALE Chelsea set to reject Real Madrid's £100m mega deal for Eden Hazard, according to reports in Belgium inter and out Inter Milan may be worst team ever for selling players before they reached their prime Cough up Fifa will pay Seamus Coleman's £50,000-a-week wages until the Everton star recovers from double leg break Not good enough Antonio Conte has sensationally rejected the chance to sign Neymar in a £155m deal from Barcelona 'I don't even like football' Neil Taylor is hammered on Twitter after breaking Seamus Coleman’s leg… but it’s an ex-councillor not the Wales defender taking the brunt of the abuse TOP BILLING Jamie O'Hara and Paul Konchesky find The Only Way is Essex with revolution at non-league Billericay 
"Adam Lallana has become very important. And then Harry Kane up front." 
That means there is no room for Jermain Defoe - who captured hearts by leading out Bradley Lowery before scoring the opener yesterday.
